title:
Theatre  Production:
(Tony Wants To Marry.)
description:
MTNF Performing Art Sponsorship sponsored a theatre art production in a Drive-In Theatre Stage Play titled "Tony Wants to Marry" written by Jerry Alagbaoso and directed by Agozie. In line with MTNF commitment to facilitate the renaissance of arts and culture in Nigeria,

This is to allow people to unwind and doubt the tension of Covid 19 while they watch from the comfort of the car.

title:
Theatre Production: 
Oluronbi The Musical
description: *MTNF uses this platform to showcase Nigerian culture and telling Nigerian stories through Arts.

title:
Theatre Production:
FLOWER THE MUSICAL
description:
MTNF Theatre Sponsorship Production in supporting Art and Culture, sponsored  "Flower the Musical". 
A message conveyed in Ballads, Monologues and Dance drama and inspired by true experiences of hope built around Six women: 
A faithful wife; An accused murderer; A corporate amazon; A trophy wife; A pleasure worker and A religious hopeful woman

title:
Theatre Production: 
Osamede.
description:
Osamede is a musically infused stage play meaning, 'who the King has Crowned' in the ancient Benin Kingdom.

Osamede, the story of an orphan girl who went from obscurity to the palace and risked her life to redeem the people of her community from a life of oppression through her remarkable courage.

title:
Theatre Productions: 
Fela and The Kalakuta Queens, Kakadu: The Musicals, Legends: The Musical
description: Theatre productions that celebrate Nigerian Arts and Culture in various parts of Lagos

title: Theatre Production: Death and King Horse man
description:
A Stage Play written by Wole Soyinka and produced by Bolanle Austen-Peters. 

The Producer who believes that retelling Nigerian/African stories is contributing to solving one of Nigeria’s problems – "youth unemployment" by engaging an array of young talents in creating this play for lovers of theatre art

title:
Theatre Production:
OMG THE MUSICAL
description:
MTNF in support of arts and culture in Nigeria sponsored “OMG The Musical”  A Drive-In to watch stage play that took a quick walk down memory lane to celebrate incredible women: Olufumilayo Ransome Kuti, Margaret Ekpo, and Hajia Gambo Sawaba.

OMG means Olufunmilayo, Margaret and Gambo, women who were known for one common goal of women’s rights and fight against the marginalization of women in Nigeria.

title: MTN-MUSON Music Scholars Program
description: To provide scholarships to indigent but talented musicians to acquire a diploma in music at the MUSON School of Music

title: Donation of ICT Lab.
description: Support of government's efforts in the provision of qualitative education,  Donation of eLibrary equipment
